text: Wait - this means that you have to run all the marketing/sales automation through your regular hub?

Nope! If I want to use automation I have to run that through:
4. Webalite's Hub!
Queue track
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G7AinOjDiNQ>

The theme setting can only be seen/update in HubSpot in the Theme Settings UI. There is no way to see/edit them locally.

If you made a child theme, then yes *_fonts.css* wont exist. You'll have to make it
Did you download Sprocket Rocket from the Marketplace or from our App?
I don’t see it in the parent theme either…
good question - let me check with the person that did that :slightly_smiling_face:
until I hear back from them, here’s what our local ‘SR’ theme CSS contains
I don’t see _fonts.css
so it must be there on a default install and perhaps got deleted? Unsure.
But I don’t believe we’ve updated this theme at all, just made a child from it

I typically wouldn't suggest making a child theme, they are a mess.

_fonts.css should be there.
I assume from your app, when I log in I see we have an entry for the theme there
if you don’t use a child theme how do you handle updates to the parent theme
parent/child themes are only really needed for Marketplace themes (since you cant edit them). if you are using our App it manages the install/updates
what happens when I modify an existing asset (say, CSS, e.g.) and you update it on your end?
Updates can only be applied by you, we don't push any update automatically. But if you did they would be overwritten
so, that means I’d lose all my local changes then? So what’s the best practice for merging/managing? source control so you can diff changes?
and I was just told it was installed via Marketplace, not the app
Even if you purchased from you can still use our App. <https://docs.sprocketrocket.co/getting-started/marketplace-integration|https://docs.sprocketrocket.co/getting-started/marketplace-integration>
If you modify the core files you won't be able to update them. So it's a trade off and up to you
I see, I think we installed via Marketplace, then realized the app was much better, then used it
so how do I get the _fonts.css file back, can I just place it in here (taken from your init.json):
and then update per your custom font instructions?
Yes that should work. Not sure why you don't have it. I'd need access to the portal to understand more
when I use the app I see ‘Revert’ for the status column on a number of files, does this mean they were edited locally and overridden?
but it’s odd because the _fonts.css file is listed here but as you can see above is not in the DM:
but clicking ‘Added’ added it right back, so I think that solved it
Revert means it was updated in the app recently. It allows you to revert changes. Incase something broke
